tit.cmt: 愚中周及の表記を修正（例：一休宗純 Sojun IKKYU 「一休」は道号、「宗純」が諱で、道号の方を大文字としていることから）Guchu Shukyu → Shukyu GUCHU

sen.j: 愚中周及（ぐちゅうしゅうきゅう、元亨3年（1323年） - 応永16年8月25日 (旧暦)（1409年10月4日））は、南北朝時代 (日本)の臨済宗の僧。
sen.e: Guchu Shukyu (1323 ~ October 4, 1409) is a priest of the Rinzai sect of the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.
Guchu Shukyu (1323 - October 4, 1409) was a priest of the Rinzai sect during the Northern and Southern Courts period.
Shukyu GUCHU (1323 - October 4, 1409) was a priest of the Rinzai sect during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
sen.cmt: 愚中周及の表記を修正Guchu Shukyu → Shukyu GUCHU南北朝時代the Northern and Southern Courts period→ the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan)

sen.e: He was from Mino Province.
He was from Mino Province.
He was from Mino Province.
Guchu is his dogo (a pseudonym as a priest).
His dogo (a pseudonym as a priest) was Guchu.
His dogo (a pseudonym as a priest) was Guchu.
Shukyu is his imina (in this case, his real name).
His imina (in this case, his real name) was Shukyu.
His imina (priest's name) was Shukyu.
sen.cmt: 「諱」この場合は「仏教徒としての名前」、すなわち法名に同じ。in this case, his real name → priest's name＜参考＞「道号」と「諱」について道号（諱とは別の名前として持っている号）＋諱（仏教徒としての名前）=僧侶の名前出典：http://www.town.washimiya.saitama.jp/kakuka/18shiryo/net_museum/mokuzangengou/mokuzan_syogai/mokuzan_syougai.htm

sen.e: His shigo (a posthumous name) is Buttoku Daitsu Zenji.

sen.j: 愚中は7歳で寺に入り、13歳で京都臨川寺の夢窓疎石に師事して出家した。
sen.e: Guchu entered a temple at the age of 7 and studied under Muso Soseki of Rinsen-ji Temple in Kyoto and became a priest at the age of 13.
Guchu entered a temple at seven years of age and studied under Muso Soseki of Rinsen-ji Temple in Kyoto and became a priest at the age of 13.
Guchu entered a temple at seven years of age and studied under Soseki MUSO of Rinsen-ji Temple in Kyoto and became a priest at the age of 13.
sen.cmt: 夢窓疎石の表記を修正Muso Soseki → Soseki MUSO

sen.j: その後比叡山において戒を受け、京都建仁寺を経て、1343年（康永2年）中国元に渡った。
sen.e: After that, he received commandments at Mt.Hiei-zan, entered Kennin-ji Temple, Kyoto, and went to study in Yuan dynasty, China in 1343.
After that, he received commandments at Mt. Hiei-zan, entered Kennin-ji Temple in Kyoto and, in 1343, went to study in the Yuan dynasty of China.
After that, he received commandments at Mt. Hiei, entered Kennin-ji Temple in Kyoto and, in 1343, went to study in the Yuan dynasty of China.
sen.cmt: 比叡山 Mt. Hiei-zan → Mt. Hiei

sen.j: 1351年（観応2年）に帰国した後、京都南禅寺などを経て、1395年（応永2年）小早川春平の開基により、安芸国に佛通寺の開山となった。
sen.e: After he returned to Japan in 1351, he entered Nanzen-ji Temple in Kyoto, and he did kaisan (founded a temple as a chief priest) of Buttsu-ji Temple by kaiki (founded with the patronage) of Haruhira KOBAYAKAWA in Aki Province in 1395.
